content.text: Assemble the apparatus with the nail passing through the third hole from C, as shown in Fig. 1.1
• Ensure that the nail is held securely in the clamp
• The distance between the nail and C is \(x\), as shown in Fig. 1.1
Measure and record \(x\)
Push the bottom of the strip horizontally through a distance of approximately \(5\mathrm{cm}\). Release the strip so that it oscillates
• Determine the period \(T\) of these oscillations
Change \(x\) by positioning the nail in a different hole and repeat **(b)**. Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(x\) and \(T\)
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\frac{1}{x}\) and \(T^2\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(T^2\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\frac{1}{x}\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
gradient =

where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants
Use your answers in **(d)(iii)** to determine the values of \(a\) and \(b\)
Give appropriate units

In this experiment, you will investigate a pendulum with a mass fixed at each end
You are provided with two partially inflated balloons. Place the larger balloon on the bench with its neck at the side, as shown in Fig. 2.1
• Put pieces of modelling clay around the balloon to stop it rolling, as shown in Fig. 2.1
• The diameter of the balloon is \(B\), as shown in Fig. 2.1
Measure and record \(B\)
Wet a small area on the top of the balloon with a damp paper towel
• Balance the transparent block on the top of the balloon, as shown viewed from above in Fig. 2.2
• The contact patch will be visible, as shown in Fig. 2.3
• The diameter of the contact patch is \(d\), as shown in Fig. 2.3
Measure and record \(d\)
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(d\)
percentage uncertainty =   .........

where \(g = 9.81 \text{N} \text{kg}^{-1}\) and \(m\) is the mass of the transparent block written on the card
Justify the number of significant figures you have given for your value of \(P\)
Repeat (a), (b) and (d) using the smaller partially inflated balloon

Describe four improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures

In this experiment, you will investigate the relationship between the pressure in a balloon and its diameter
